title.narrative: Child Protection Service Provision for Vulnerable Syrian Refugee Children and Youth

description.narrative: Overall objective: To build and strengthen Child Protection Systems in Emergencies Specific Objectives: To enhance the well-being of vulnerable Syrian refugee children and youth affected by conflict situations, through enhanced non-formal educational and protection services

Result 1: 150 Children, youth, their families and caregivers are protected through the establishment of a Child Protection Unit (CPU)
Activities:
1 CPU Is established to provide psychosocial support to extreme vulnerable children/youth and their families with awareness, case identification, case management, children psychological support and referral systems, case follow-up.CPU management:Provide space and facilities(through the EU Nobel grant)Identify and assess children, youths, and families whose cases require specific attention and assistanceEnsure immediate follow-up by the psychosocial counselors according to UNICEF/DoLSa standardsTrain refugee staff to achieve excellent skills in CP case managementEnsure data collection in the CP IMSDevelop a protection monitoring mechanismShare relevant information from assessments with stakeholders through coordination meetings
Result 2 :
500 Children and youth are protected in integrated Friendly spaces and mobile activities.
Activities :
Maintain/Rehabilitate 1 CFS to provide integrated psychosocial services to children in the age groups 3-5/6-12Activate 1 CFS to provide psychosocial services, in the age groups 3-5/ 6-12Activate 1 YFS to provide integrated psychosocial services in the age groups 13-15/15-18Support the mobile team to provide basic psychosocial services (recreational, sports activities) in community space/ ACTED tentsRefurbishment of latrines in CFSRefurbishment of latrines in YFSCreate a playground/green area to provide organized activities and a better quality of the spacePeer-to-Peer activities to engage children in creative solutions about Environment and Risk Awareness
